title: Cyberslacking L1 – YouTube category links – SWG Audit
description: Test perimeter category and URL policy. YouTube category links only. Blocked = perimeter passed; allowed = perimeter may not enforce restrictions.
keywords: SWG Audit, cyberslacking test, category policy, URL policy, YouTube, perimeter security
headline: Cyberslacking – Level 1: YouTube category links
testObjective: Test whether your SWG can enforce category-based access policies to block non-productive web content during work hours.
attackVector: Employees access entertainment, gaming, music, and sports content on platforms like YouTube, reducing productivity and consuming corporate bandwidth.

steps.title: Configure your SWG
steps.description: Whitelist swgaudit.com to allow access to this page. Configure category-based blocking for entertainment, gaming, music, and sports.

steps.title: Verify your identity
steps.description: Submit your business email to unlock the simulation.

steps.title: Run the test
steps.description: Click each YouTube category link. If your SWG blocks or redirects access, it passed for that category. If content loads normally, your perimeter may not be enforcing category restrictions.

feedbackFail: Non‑productive content loaded = perimeter may not enforce category restrictions.
feedbackPass: Access blocked or redirected = perimeter passed.
